intro: Triumfetta misella, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Triumfetta misella is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and along stream banks.
